entries.name: Spellcasting
entries: At 3rd level, the magic of your bloodline is unleashed, or at the very least you begin to gain control over it. See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} for general rules of spellcasting and chapter 11 for the {@filter sorcerer spell list|spells|class=sorcerer}.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter sorcerer spell list|spells|class=sorcerer}. You learn an additional sorcerer cantrip of your choice at 10th level.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Bloodrager Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your {@filter sorcerer spells|spells|class=sorcerer} of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
For example, if you know the 1st-level spell {@spell shield} and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast {@spell shield} using either slot.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st-Level and Higher
entries: You know three 1st-level sorcerer spells of your choice, two of which you must choose from the evocation and transmutation spells on the sorcerer spell list.

The Spells Known column of the Bloodrager Spellcasting table shows when you learn more sorcerer spells of 1st level or higher. Each of these spells must be an evocation or transmutation spell of your choice, and must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 7th level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.
The spells you learn at 8th, 14th, and 20th level can come from any school of magic.

Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of the sorcerer spells you know with another spell of your choice from the sorcerer spell list. The new spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots, and it must be an evocation or transmutation spell, unless you're replacing the spell you gained at 3rd, 8th, 14th, or 20th level from any school of magic.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your sorcerer spells, since the power of your magic relies on your ability to direct your fury into magical energy. You use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a sorcerer spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Bloodrage
entries: Also at 3rd level, you gain the ability to not only access your bloodline, but also instinctually cast your spells without needing to focus all your attention onto them. You may cast spells gained from this Path while raging, but still are unable to hold concentration on them, and any spells gained from other classes or features cannot be cast during the rage.
Casting a spell that targets an opponent during a rage will allow you to maintain your rage, and you add your rage damage bonus to any spell damage rolls.
In addition, pick a bloodline from the list below. This will determine the specifics of what features your bloodrager will get as they advance in level.

entries.caption: Bloodrager Bloodline
footnotes: *Only you gain the Rage damage bonus when the spell is cast

entries.name: Instinctual Mage
entries: At 6th level, you are fully acquainted with your magical abilities, both in and out of battle. You no longer need material components to cast spells unless they have a specified gold cost.
You also gain proficiency in one skill depending on your chosen bloodline, or double the proficiency bonus if you're already proficient in that skill.

entries.name: Greater Bloodrage
entries: At 10th level, you gain a spell from the Bloodline Spells list below depending on your chosen bloodline and add it to your known spells. When you enter a rage, you may use your action to cast this spell immediately without using a spell slot. If the spell requires concentration, you can concentrate on it while raging.
After you use this ability, you can't use it again until completing a long rest.

entries.name: Untapped Stores
entries: At 14th level, you are so in tune with the magic in your blood that you can alter the spells you cast with Metamagic, in a similar manner to a sorcerer. You gain one Metamagic option depending on your bloodline, and you also gain access to the {@class sorcerer|phb|Font of Magic} feature.
You have 5 sorcery points you can use to fuel metamagic alterations to your spells. You regain all sorcery points on a long rest.
